author: BarryNolte
body:
Added quotes at the appropriate places to enable running commands that
contained spaces in the filename/path.  Also needed to add pester.psm1
to path of Import-Module.

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body: Hi **@BarryNolte**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! This seems like a small (but important) contribution, so no Contribution License Agreement is required at this point. Real humans will now evaluate your PR. TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: BarryNolte
comments.body: I updated the branch, I got ahead of myself on the fix and didn't need the hard coded file, thanks.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @BarryNolte - to make reviewing easier on us, can you rebase or squash?

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
**@BarryNolte**, Thanks for signing the contribution license agreement so quickly! Actual humans will now validate the agreement and then evaluate the PR.
Thanks, MSBOT;

comments.author: dlwyatt
comments.body: Why is Invoke-Expression being used here?  Without it, you wouldn't have to worry about quoting anything manually.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: @dlwyatt - good call.  @mirichmo, who signed off on your change :)

title: Pester tests wouldn't run from build directory with spaces
